title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: A few showers may occur in Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces, today (14), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Sri Lankan passenger arrested at BIA with over 2 kg of heroin
byline: A Sri Lankan national arriving from Malaysia has been arrested by the Airport Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) for attempting to smuggle 2.3 kilograms of heroin, police said.

title: Cambodia shuts Thailand border crossings over deadly fighting
byline: Cambodia shut its border crossings with Thailand on Saturday (Dec 13), after Bangkok denied US President Donald Trump’s claim that a truce had been agreed to end days of deadly fighting.

title: Two dead, eight injured after shooting at Brown University in US
byline: Two people were killed and eight critically wounded on Saturday (Dec 13) in a shooting at Brown University, the prestigious Ivy League school in Rhode Island, authorities said.

title: Sydney Bondi Beach shooting: 10 confirmed dead while at least 12 others injured
byline: Australian police have confirmed that 10 people have died in Sunday’s shooting at Bondi Beach, including one of the shooters and nine victims.

title: Education should not be a burden on children amid post-disaster recovery – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that education should not be a burden to children during the recovery period after the disaster, and priority must be given to their psychosocial well-being, the PM’s Office said.

title: President commends Sri Lanka Navy’s disaster response, urges unity to rebuild nation
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that the recent disaster dealt a severe blow to an economy that was being rebuilt steadily and systematically and that in the face of such a challenge, it is the duty of every citizen not to withdraw or remain in hopelessness, but to come together with unwavering determination to restore the nation.

title: Belarus frees 123 prisoners as US lifts sanctions
byline: Belarus has freed 123 prisoners, including prominent opposition activist Maria Kolesnikova, after the US agreed to lift sanctions on the country.

title: Govt. to expedite resettlement of people in relief centres
byline: The Commissioner General of Essential Services Prabath Chandrakeerthi says that nearly 7,000 people are currently sheltered in relief centres, and steps will be taken to resettle them within two to three months.

title: Gunshots heard in Sydney’s Bondi Beach as police urge people to stay away
byline: NSW Police are responding to reports of an active shooter at Bondi Beach in Sydney’s eastern suburbs.

title: Several injured after shooting in Sydney’s Bondi Beach, two people arrested
byline: Two people have been arrested at Bondi Beach in Sydney’s eastern suburbs as NSW Police respond to reports of an active shooter on Sunday evening.

title: UAE relief teams conclude humanitarian mission in Sri Lanka
byline: Relief teams from the United Arab Emirates have concluded their humanitarian mission in Sri Lanka as part of the urgent response launched by the UAE, to support those affected by Cyclone Ditwah and the landslides that struck the country.

title: Vin Diesel “wrote a role” for Cristiano Ronaldo in final ‘Fast & Furious’ movie
byline: As Vin Diesel goes full throttle toward the Fast & Furious grand finale, he’s expanding the franchise’s star-studded extended cast with the onscreen debut of a global star.

title: Shah Rukh Khan meets Lionel Messi in Kolkata
byline: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan on Saturday met Argentine footballer Lionel Messi, who is currently in India for his “GOAT Tour”.

title: Value of ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ fund exceeds Rs. 3.4 billion - Finance Secretary
byline: The ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund, established by the Government to provide relief to people affected by recent disasters caused by Cyclone Ditwah, has received over Rs. 3,421 million to date, Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma, said.

title: Floods and landslides in Indonesia’s Sumatra kill over one thousand people
byline: Severe floods and landslides in Indonesia’s Sumatra have killed more than 1,000 people, rescuers said, as authorities step up relief operations following weeks of torrential rain.

title: Foreign-made revolver discovered in Ekala by police
byline: Police have recovered a foreign-made revolver that had been concealed with the alleged intention of committing a crime.

title: Leakage reported in pipeline from ship unloading crude oil at Colombo Port
byline: A leakage has been reported in a pipeline from a ship unloading crude oil at the Colombo Port.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from adverse weather climbs to 643
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country over the past few days has climbed to 643, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Guidelines issued on distributing disaster relief funds
byline: Guidelines have been issued by the Ministry of Defence to District and Divisional Secretaries pertaining to the distribution of disaster relief funds to the affected people across the country.

title: Number of houses destroyed in recent disaster surpasses 6,000
byline: The total number of houses completely destroyed across Sri Lanka due to the severe disaster situation caused by Cyclone Ditwah has surpassed 6,000, according to the latest report issued by the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: Pramodya Wickramasinghe to be re-appointed Chairman of cricket selection committee?
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket sources have reported that former cricketer Pramodya Wickramasinghe is set to be appointed as the new chairman of the National Cricket Selection Committee.

title: Five including woman killed in separate road accidents across several areas
byline: Five people, including a woman and two youths, have reportedly died in separate fatal road accidents across different parts of the island yesterday (13), police stated.

title: Death toll due to Cyclone Ditwah continues to increase
byline: The number of deaths linked to Cyclone Ditwah, which made landfall in Sri Lanka more than two weeks ago continues increase, according to the Disaster Management Center (DMC).

title: World leaders express horror, revulsion at Bondi Beach shooting
byline: World leaders queued up on Sunday (Dec 14) to express their horror and revulsion at a mass shooting which killed 11 people at Sydney’s iconic Bondi Beach.

title: Individual arrested for assaulting worker in viral social media footage
byline: An individual has been taken into custody by the Katugastota Police in connection with an incident in which a worker engaged in removing soil and boulders from eroded sections of the Kandy– Gohagoda road was assaulted.

title: Tourist arrivals in December top 70,000
byline: A total of 70,023 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in December, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Luxury Cruise Ship with 400 passengers arrives in Colombo
byline: A luxury cruise ship belonging to the Ritz-Carlton fleet, carrying 400 passengers, arrived today (14) at the Colombo Port.

title: One of the alleged shooters in deadly attacks at Sydney’s Bondi Beach named
byline: One of the alleged shooters in the deadly attacks at Bondi Beach in Sydney was Naveed Akram, a man from the city’s south-west, according to a senior law enforcement official.

title: Transport Minister inspects damaged Balana section of Upcountry railway line
byline: Minister Bimal Rathnayaka has inspected the Balana section of the Upcountry railway line which was severely damaged due to recent landslides.

title: Govt seeks to nurture responsible human resource that protects environment: PM Harini
byline: The government is seeking to nurture a responsible human resource that loves and protects the environment, demonstrates leadership, upholds compassion and a sense of collectivity and values democracy, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: Indian aircraft carrying 25MT of essential supplies including medicine arrives
byline: An aircraft carrying 25 metric tons of essential supplies, including 17 types of critical medicines and stocks of dry rations necessary to sustain the country’s healthcare services arrived from India.

title: Showers expected to increase from Tuesday
byline: The Department of Meteorology says under the influence of an easterly wave, showery conditions in the country are expected to increase to some extent from Tuesday.
